meanings.definition: The quality or state of being coercive.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's strict rules created coercivities in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The coercivities of the dictator made the citizens fear for their freedom.
meanings.sent3: The coercivities of the grumpy cat made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The coercivities of the storm forced everyone indoors.
meanings.sent5: The coercivities of the haunted house were palpable in the air.

meanings.definition: The use of force or intimidation to obtain compliance.
meanings.sent1: The criminal's coercivities led to his arrest by the police.
meanings.sent2: The coercivities of the bully made the students give up their lunch money.
meanings.sent3: The coercivities of the toddler trying to get a cookie were adorable.
meanings.sent4: The coercivities of the wind against the trees were like a battle.
meanings.sent5: The coercivities of the traffic jam caused frustration among drivers.
